name: Pistol Squat (Single-Legged Squat)
how_to_perform:
* Stand on one leg, with the other foot lifted off the ground. Hold onto a stable object or have a spotter if needed for balance.
* Slowly lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
* Keep your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your back straight.
* Push through your back heel to return to the starting position.
* Alternate legs with each repetition.
short_summary: The pistol squat is a lower body exercise that primarily targets the quads and hamstrings, performed by standing on one leg and lowering down into a squat position.
